channel.title: Rune Revolution #317 Framework
channel.description:
[center][size=18pt]Rune Revolution[/size][/center]
Rune Revolution is a new input output framework that was originally named Styx. This is a different version than Galaxy which I recently released. They're both based off Styx but I developed this one much further. This is not a complete server, it's just a speedy little framework. I'll list the features below.
[size=14pt]Features[/size]
[ul][li]Login protocol decoding completed.[/li] [li]Packet protocol decoding nearly completed.[/li] [li]Incredibly basic player updating. Should be re-written.[/li] [li]Packet loading via XML[/li] [li]Uses NIO for fast asynchronous actions.[/li] [li]Primitive task system, functions as needed.[/li] [li]Entity based player system.[/li] [li]Multiple connection handling.[/li] [li]Flexible networking system.[/li] [li]Multi-Threaded.[/li] [li]Easy to follow packaging.[/li] [li]Outgoing packets base written.[/li] [li]Support for new task's being added to the Game Engine[/li] [li]No deadlocks.[/li] [li]Non-Thread per client approach.[/li] [li]Update Flags implementation.[/li] [li]No outside libraries utilized.[/li][/ul]
I plan to continue this and wanted some opinions and suggestions. Im releasing this now because soon i'm going to be very busy preparing for school so I wanted to pump a second version out while I had time. Credits are included in the source download. Any questions, suggestions, or bug reports can be left as a comment on this thread and I will get back to you with a fix or response as soon as I can. This server is semi-class heavy but as a whole it functions beautifully.
This server contains the same amount of [b]in-game[/b] content as the original winter-love but it will crush any IO server in performance. I hope someone can learn something from this as I have. Finally I'd like to reiterate one more time, like I said before I will not be quitting this. I am actually very excited to continue, I just wanted some opinions and suggestions on the current design.
Picture: [IMG]http://i39.tinypic.com/23h7hpz.png[/img]
Download: http://up.ht/16Sutlg

item.title: Rune Revolution #317 Framework
item.dc:creator: @RandQm RandQm
item.description:
@RandQm wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:19, topic:527161”][quote author=RandQm link=topic=645908.msg4345655#msg4345655 date=1375837667]

I have a request. Please, make the design in your next servers something like this:

  • indicates extension/implementation.

Model.java

  • Player.java
    – NPC.java
  • Object.java
  • Item.java

It’s a very nice design I’d like to see in a server.

I’m currently building a server on this framework which I will continue together with iz3 legend once he has fixed a login bug.
The current design is:

rs2
-entities
--mobile
---npc
---player
--still
---object
---grounditem
-items
--inventory
--bank
--equipment

[/quote]
Why are NPC and Player different? Player should be Character and NPC should extend Character. :-)[/quote]
Npc & Player are both at the same height.
They’re both mobile entities that pretty much can do the same actions.
The only difference is that one is human controlled and the other server controlled.
Which makes it 2 different mobs that you don’t want to extend on one

Read full topic

item.title: Rune Revolution #317 Framework
item.dc:creator: @Ares1 Ares_
item.description:
@Ares1 wrote:

[quote=“iz3 legend, post:8, topic:527161”][quote author=Ares_ link=topic=645908.msg4344234#msg4344234 date=1375638669]

The update flags are for entities only, that’s why they are named as such. I guess its simply personal preference though. The naming of absolute X and Y are again personal preference. Thanks for the feed back, i’ll address the naming concerns since I agree that better name’s could be given. I’d also be grateful for anymore feedback

I agree it is more personal preference but it’s a bit more common to use ‘x’ & ‘y’ etc. But anyways i’ll take a more in depth look at it once I get home again and give you more feedback.
[/quote]

Alright, thank you.[/quote]
Wel I realized I don’t know nio that well so I cannot give you advice etc on that so I will not criticize your implementation anyways one last thing.

/**
  * The IP address the server will listen on.
  */
 public static final String SERVER_IP = "127.0.0.1";

That’s not needed because it just listens off the port 43594, just some minor stuff I have discovered once I learn a little more about NIO I will give you feed back on your implementation.

Read full topic
